happy_screen.title: Great! Your Paddy Leaf is Healthy
happy_screen.subtitle: Keep up the good work and continue to care for your plants.

not_paddy.title: Not a Paddy Leaf
not_paddy.subtitle: Please upload a valid paddy leaf image for analysis.

Bacterial Leaf Blight.description: Caused by Xanthomonas oryzae pv. oryzae. It starts as water-soaked streaks that turn yellow, causing wilting and drying of leaves.
Bacterial Leaf Blight.prevention3: ğŸŒ± Remove and destroy crop residues.
Bacterial Leaf Blight.treatment2: ğŸ’Š Apply Streptomycin with Copper Oxychloride.

Brown Spot.description: Caused by Bipolaris oryzae fungus. It forms circular brown spots on leaves, reducing photosynthesis and grain yield.
Brown Spot.prevention1: ğŸŒ± Treat seeds with fungicide before sowing.
Brown Spot.prevention3: ğŸŒ± Apply balanced fertilizers with nitrogen and potassium.
Brown Spot.treatment3: ğŸ’Š Maintain field sanitation and remove weeds.

Healthy Rice Leaf.description: The rice leaf is healthy, green, and free from visible disease symptoms.
Healthy Rice Leaf.prevention3: ğŸŒ± Use balanced fertilizers and keep fields clean.
Healthy Rice Leaf.treatment3: ğŸ’Š Monitor fields for early disease detection.

Leaf Blast.description: Caused by Magnaporthe oryzae fungus. It creates spindle-shaped lesions with gray centers and brown edges.
Leaf Blast.treatment2: ğŸ’Š Apply Carbendazim in early stages.
Leaf Blast.treatment3: ğŸ’Š Use systemic fungicides for severe cases.

Leaf scald.description: Caused by Microdochium oryzae fungus. It shows water-soaked lesions that spread along veins, causing drying.
Leaf scald.prevention1: ğŸŒ± Rotate crops to avoid buildup.
Leaf scald.prevention2: ğŸŒ± Prevent drought and water stress.

Narrow Brown Leaf Spot.description: Caused by Cercospora oryzae fungus. It forms narrow, linear brown lesions parallel to veins.
Narrow Brown Leaf Spot.treatment2: ğŸ’Š Apply organic manure to improve soil.
Narrow Brown Leaf Spot.treatment3: ğŸ’Š Remove plant residues from field.

Neck Blast.description: Severe form of blast caused by Magnaporthe oryzae. It affects panicle neck, leading to empty grains.
Neck Blast.prevention3: ğŸŒ± Maintain proper spacing and irrigation.
Neck Blast.treatment1: ğŸ’Š Spray systemic fungicides like Tricyclazole.
Neck Blast.treatment2: ğŸ’Š Apply foliar sprays at booting stage.
Neck Blast.treatment3: ğŸ’Š Use balanced fertilizers with potassium.

Rice Hispa.description: An insect pest that scrapes green tissues, leaving white streaks on leaves.
Rice Hispa.prevention1: ğŸŒ± Encourage natural predators like lady beetles.
Rice Hispa.prevention3: ğŸŒ± Rotate rice with non-host crops.
Rice Hispa.treatment3: ğŸ’Š Flood fields to control pupae.

Sheath Blight.description: Caused by Rhizoctonia solani fungus. It produces irregular lesions on sheaths that spread in humid conditions.
Sheath Blight.prevention1: ğŸŒ± Maintain field hygiene and remove weeds.
Sheath Blight.prevention3: ğŸŒ± Use resistant varieties if available.
Sheath Blight.treatment2: ğŸ’Š Add neem cake or organic matter to soil.
Sheath Blight.treatment3: ğŸ’Š Ensure proper spacing for air flow.

Unknown.description: The disease affecting the paddy leaf could not be identified. Please consult an expert for further analysis.
Unknown.prevention1: ğŸŒ± Monitor your plants regularly for any changes.
Unknown.prevention3: ğŸŒ± Ensure proper irrigation and fertilization.
Unknown.treatment1: ğŸ’Š Seek advice from a local agricultural extension officer.
Unknown.treatment2: ğŸ’Š Consider sending a sample to a plant pathology lab.
